Package edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.controller

Class PostController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.powdr.controller.PostController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/posts")
@ExposesResourceFor(Post.class)
public class PostController
extends java.lang.Object
    REST Controller class for Post to receive parameter values taken from HTTP requests to their respective specified URL endpoints, and returning serialized JSON object results to HTTP responses.

        @GetMapping(value="/{keyword}",
            produces="application/json")
public java.util.List<Post> getPostByContentContains​(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth,
                                                     @PathVariable
                                                     java.lang.String keyword)
        Gets and displays posts gathered by a keyword.
        Parameters:
        keyword - A word specified by the user to match related post.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of posts related to a keyword.

      • getAll

        @GetMapping(produces="application/json",
            params={"!start","!end"})
public java.util.List<Post> getAll​(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
        Gets and displays all posts by a specified user.
        Parameters:
        auth - The current authenticated user.
        Returns:
        Returns a users list of posts.

      • getPostByTimestamp

        @GetMapping(produces="application/json")
public java.util.List<Post> getPostByTimestamp​(@RequestParam
                                               java.util.Date timestamp)
        Gets and displays posts by date posted.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The point in time that a post was created.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of posts created on a certain date.

      • post

        @PostMapping(produces="application/json",
             consumes="application/json")
@ResponseStatus(CREATED)
public Post post​(@RequestBody
                 Post post,
                 org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
        Gets or creates posts depending on whether or not they exist.
        Parameters:
        post - ID of a specific user.
        auth - Current authenticated user.

      • delete

        @DeleteMapping("/{postId}")
@ResponseStatus(NO_CONTENT)
public void delete​(@PathVariable
                   java.util.UUID postId,
                   org.springframework.security.core.Authentication auth)
        Deletes posts specified by the user.
        Parameters:
        postId - ID of a specific post.
        auth - Current authenticated user.
